title: i think nasus is held back by the strength of wither
body:
the spell itself being powerful is fine, but late game even if he isn't a carry any more wither still might as well be a disable for any auto attacking champion he's in range of. 

imo the biggest thing that gates the rest of him is the fact that wither has absurdly low downtime. with 45 cdr you have 1 second before either comes back up which is insane for being targeted and with no other conditions to it. the sheer power this spell has for its reliability is nuts and guarantees he'll at least have SOME relevance in any game 

i think weakening wither might be necessary in order to free him up for power elsewhere, or by giving him a condition to fulfill in combat like most other juggernauts have. some quick ideas would be making wither have an initial tether on it or making it stronger when the target is on his E. these are just spitballs but I think adding a little more complexity to his spells would be a good start to modernizing him

Wither is not as strong as people think. People see the final second of Wither and think it's the same throughout the ability. In reality, Wither slows for less than 65% as its average at its highest rank (with the AS slow being an average of 32.5%). And those slows are all Wither does. It does not deal damage. It does not give Nasus any bonuses. It does not weaken the defenses of his target. It just slows.

> Also, 65%? Where are you at, it's 99% at max rank.

It's 95% at max rank for the final second of the ability. It's only 35% for the first second. The average slow it does is (35% + 50% + 65% + 80% + 95%)/5 = 65%. HOWEVER, movement speed slows diminish when they get strong enough. The absolute lowest movement speed it's possible to achieve outside of things that simply prevent movement is 110.

Let's take your example of 400 MS and see what the true average slow is over the duration of Wither. For the first second, movement speed is slowed by 35%, resulting in 260 for the first second. For the second second, movement speed is slowed by 50%, resulting in 200 MS for the second second. For the third second, movement speed is slowed by 65%, resulting in uh oh. Movement speed is reduced below 180, so a new formula is introduced. The would-be MS is halved, and then gets added to 110. So, for the third second, MS would be 140/2 + 110, which is 180. That is a 55% slow instead of 65%. Let's see what happens on second four. 400 reduced by 80% is 80. 80/2 + 110 is 150, meaning a 62.5% slow. And, finally, for the fifth second, 400 reduced by 95% is 20. 20/2 + 110 is 130, meaning a 70% slow.

Averaged out, Wither slowed for (35% + 50% + 55% + 62.5% + 70%)/5 = 54.5% slow.

Nasus's problem is definitely not his damage. It's the fact his overall game plan is significantly inferior to the other juggernauts. The other main juggernauts (Illaoi, Darius, hell even Voli) are all much more early game centric and transition into excellent teamfighters once late game comes around. Nasus has a VERY match up dependent early game, a VERY good mid game if he doesn't get shitstomped, and a bad late game ONLY because he can never actually utilize his stacks on a moving target since the only thing he can actually hit in teamfights are tanks which take next to no damage from him since they all stack armor naturally, have Ninja Tabis (a big bonerkiller for Siphoning Strike), and Nasus simply doesn't do enough damage to do anything about it.

I have a few suggestions that MIGHT help with Nasus. We can go with some sort of slow resist or move speed boost in his kit if they want Nasus to actually stand a chance at hitting ranged champions or we can go down route B and make him actually deal with things he can hit. In order to deal with tanks we have 2 solutions that might help out. Solution 1 is give him a Trundle like effect on his ult instead of what he has now where he just starts taking their stats instead of gaining some of his own. It would obviously be WORSE than Trundle ult on the steal (since it is AoE), but it would make him a better teamfighter overall and let him actually damage a tank without a Last Whisper. Another option is to give his Q the Mundo Q mechanic in some manner. It would still stack like normal, but it would also stack a %max health damage part on it and it would choose the larger of the 2 numbers on it when hitting someone. It would still get reduced by armor, but it would at least let him dent tanks a bit (while probably only using the flat on monsters since adding a 400 damage cap like other spells would simply do worse than whatever the flat would be).
